section.title: View and manage quotas
section.para: To prevent system capacities from being exhausted without notification, you can set up quotas. Quotas are operational limits. For example, the number of gigabytes allowed for each tenant can be controlled so that cloud resources are optimized. Quotas can be enforced at both the tenant (or project) and the tenant-user level.
Typically, you change quotas when a project needs more than 10 volumes or 1 TB on a Compute node.
Using the Dashboard, you can view default Compute and Block Storage quotas for new tenants, as well as update quotas for existing tenants.

note.para: Using the command-line interface, you can manage quotas for the OpenStack Compute Service, the OpenStack Block Storage Service, and the OpenStack Networking Service (see ). Additionally, you can update Compute service quotas for tenant users.

section.para: The following table describes the Compute and Block Storage service quotas:

step.para: Log in to the OpenStack dashboard.
On the Admin tab, click the Defaults category.
Click the Default Quotas tab to view the default quotas for the Compute and Block Storage services.

note.para: You can sort the table by clicking on either the Quota Name or Limit column headers.

step.para: Log in to the OpenStack dashboard.
On the Admin tab, click the Projects category.
In the More drop-down list for a project, click Modify Quotas.
On the Quota tab in the Edit Project window, edit the quota values. Then, click Save.

note.para: The dashboard does not show all possible project quotas. To view and update the quotas for a service, use its command-line client. See .
